subject: Re: [junit] ClassLoader and excluded.properties file
msgSnippet: ... There is a copy of excluded.properties in junit.jar, so either (1) edit that one, or (2) delete it from the .jar and include your own through the
messageBody:
Sid wrote:

> I am working on junit for last couple of months. I want a changed
> excluded.properties file to be used with junit. I tried to do it but i
> could'nt make it work. Can someone please help me in this regard. just
> consider me a newbee and explain where to put it, what should be th
> folder structure, how to include it in classpath. I am calling the
> class through ant with java. I want to skip few pakages to be reloaded
> each time.

There is a copy of excluded.properties in junit.jar, so either (1) edit
that one, or (2) delete it from the .jar and include your own through
the classpath.

It's possible you were including your own copy, but JUnit's default copy
is always being used first. For a QUICK TEST, but the directory
containing your excluded.properties BEFORE junit.jar in the classpath.
Even if that works, I recommend not having two copies: it's too easy to
make a mistake re-arranging classpath entries three months from now,
after you've forgot you did this. :)

Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
